edu.umass.cs.nio.nioutils

Class SampleNodeConfig<NodeIDType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umass.cs.nio.nioutils.SampleNodeConfig<NodeIDType>
  • Type Parameters:
    NodeIDType - This class is a simple utility to quickly set up a simple node config object when port numbers can take "don't care" values. It is also especially convenient for a local (single-machine) setup. This class is mainly useful for quick testing.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    NodeConfig<NodeIDType>, Stringifiable<NodeIDType>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ReconfigurableSampleNodeConfig

    public class SampleNodeConfig<NodeIDType>
extends java.lang.Object
implements NodeConfig<NodeIDType>
    Author:
    V. Arun

      • localSetup

        public void localSetup(int startNodeID,
                       int nNodes)
        The caller can either specify the number of nodes, nNodes, or specify a set of integer node IDs explicitly. In the former case, nNodes from 0 to nNodes-1 will the node IDs. In the latter case, the explicit set of node IDs will be used.
        Parameters:
        startNodeID -
        nNodes - Number of nodes created.

      • getNodePort

        public int getNodePort(NodeIDType ID)
        Maps each node ID to a port number. If ID is an integer, then the port number is calculated as defaultport + ID, else it is defaultPort + ID.hashCode(). The port calculated above modulo 65536 is returned in order to ensure legitimate port numbers.
        Specified by:
        getNodePort in interface NodeConfig<NodeIDType>
        Returns:
        Port number corresponding to id.

      • getPort

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Port + default offset.
